incidents.name: [Retro Sync Insights failures] Affected

incident_updates.body: Flex UI Teams View was degraded for 11 minutes between 12:05 and 12:16 UTC Time on 03/02/2025. During this period of time customers wouldn't be able to create filters on Flex UI Teams View. However, there was no impact on already existing filters and UI would have worked as expected, unless there was any new filter created by the supervisor.
Our engineers are currently investigating the customer impact of a retroactive issue with Flex Insights. We will follow up and provide customer impact details within 2 hours.

incidents.name: Impact to MMS and OTT Messages Between 1:31P.M. PST and 1:38P.M. PST

incident_updates.body: Twilio MMS and OTT messages were degraded for 8 minutes between 1:31 p.m. and 1:38 p.m. Pacific Time on January 30, 2025. During this time approximately 110k message requests errored with "5xx". The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Customers Unable to Access New Account Creation and MFA Reset Pages in Console

incident_updates.body: The problem with Access New Account Creation and MFA Reset Pages in Console has been resolved, and the service is functioning normally at this time.

We have identified the root cause of the issue, preventing some customers from accessing pages within the Twilio Console to self-serve creation of additional accounts and reset their MFA enrollment. We are working with our vendor partner to resolve the issue. We recommend that any customer using Chrome as the browser to log in retry using Edge as the browser. We expect to provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Inbound Message Delivery Delays to a Subset of Phone Numbers in Switzerland

incident_updates.body: We have fully investigated the Inbound Message delay issue, and it was determined that the impact was limited to a small set of customers, who have been contacted individually to address any concerns. All systems are operational.

We are experiencing message delays to a subset of Twilio Switzerland Phone Numbers. Customers may experience latency in receiving SMS messages from various mobile networks in Switzerland. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Programmable Messaging. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Call Failures from Subscribers to Norway Twilio Phone

incident_updates.body: The issue causing call failures to Twilio from Norway has been resolved, and the service is functioning normally at this time.

We have started seeing recovery for calls to Twilio from Norway. We will continue to monitor to ensure a full recovery. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
